text: thanks! I gave UNIX a try but must've done it wrong, didn't do this exact code. I ended up finding a workaround of just using the custom code to not just output the date, but also do a PATCH request to update another property, that I could then use further in the flow.

Does anyone know how to use regex replace to take a 10 digit number and put hyphens in it?

i have been trying these two to no avail:
• regex_replace([phone_number], "(\d[{3})(\d[{3})(\d[{4})", "$1-$2-$3")
• concat(left(XXX,3),"-",left(right(XXX,7),3),"-",right(XXX,3))
system does not like when i use left(right), it doesnt even allow me to save it.
